balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}. Requirements: - `account` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

exists(uint256).details: Indicates whether any token exist with a given id, or not.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

totalSupply(uint256).details: Total amount of tokens in with a given id.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

claim(address,uint256).notice: Nft holders claim their interest and principal.

repay(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Admin repays to let users claim. You can repay several times because all `_finalValue`s are summed up.

withdrawResidue(uint256).notice: Admin withdraws the money to repay later when users do not claim for a long time. NOTE: Do not _burn to allow users claim later.

userdoc.notice: This repays the interest & principal at once until the maturity date. This contract has no need to The admin mint and sell NFT
